messages: 8c6ed2a880a75d5523375ef1404e9971 (02:00): i have only one
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (02:00): oops.    we use one instance per application database
8c6ed2a880a75d5523375ef1404e9971 (02:00): let me asking to the DBA
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (02:00): you start/stop oracle instances with those dbstart/dbshut scripts, but they in turn use the svrmgr or whatever
8c6ed2a880a75d5523375ef1404e9971 (02:01): all software run in the same instale
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (02:01): then its all tangled together.
8c6ed2a880a75d5523375ef1404e9971 (02:08): for kill something in linux i make kill -9 pid
8c6ed2a880a75d5523375ef1404e9971 (02:08): and solaris how is it ?
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:09): same
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:09): but.
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:09): I'd do kill -15 first, then kill -9.
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:09): because most people don't understand signals.
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:10): sig 15 asks the program to terminate normally & clean up.
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:10): sig 9 can't be held, stopped, or ignored.  It's exit immediately.
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:10): very messy.
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:10): it's the admin equivalent of a sawed-off shotgun.
4f9226ba4c5011f9f7dec18e77e72af1 (02:11): I know it's just a matter of personal taste, but would you make a whole big /  on a 146GB disk or you would divide into /var , /tmp, etc. ?
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:11): it depends on the application.
4f9226ba4c5011f9f7dec18e77e72af1 (02:11): Oracle
4f9226ba4c5011f9f7dec18e77e72af1 (02:11): database
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:11): split it up
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:12): put the individual instances on their own slices
4f9226ba4c5011f9f7dec18e77e72af1 (02:12): no, those sit on the SAN
4f9226ba4c5011f9f7dec18e77e72af1 (02:12): the local root disk only holds the oracle software and OS
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:12): you didn't mention SAN.
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:12): lol
4f9226ba4c5011f9f7dec18e77e72af1 (02:12): hehe, sorry
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:12): I'd still split it up
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:13): I split off root, var, and opt typically
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:13): mirror and encapsulate root
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:14): (and by root, I mean root disk, not just root partition)
a068d03612a6a4df8556db3786dbfc67 (02:15): Yeah there are other root things
a068d03612a6a4df8556db3786dbfc67 (02:15): root beer
a068d03612a6a4df8556db3786dbfc67 (02:16): root ofallevil

d228a545ced7d55480ff1c021e8b0c03 (02:56): hi, as i understand, in prstat -size is the memory used by proccess, and rss is swap used ?
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:57): SIZE  The total virtual memory size of the process,  includ-
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:57): ing  all  mapped  files and devices, in kilobytes (K),
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:57): megabytes (M), or gigabytes (G). The resident set size
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:57): of the process (RSS), in kilobytes (K), megabytes (M),
680e5dbb06e391dd303ff6aea9ab31b8 (02:57): or gigabytes (G).
d228a545ced7d55480ff1c021e8b0c03 (03:02): oO, i missed it, thanks
